benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/availableBasePlans - Retrieve available base plans

covered: Valid Request: Successful retrieval scenarios for no accountId and with a valid accountId (TC01, TC02) are present.
Empty Response: Catalog-empty scenarios (TC03, TC14) verify an empty JSON array is returned with 200.
Query Parameters: Multiple parameter cases are tested: valid accountId, non-existent accountId, invalid format, and unsupported extra parameters (TC02, TC04, TC05, TC08).
Authorization: Unauthorized access is tested (TC06) to assert authentication failure (401).
Error Handling / Dependent Service Failures: System unavailable, timeout and degraded dependent service behaviors are covered (TC07, TC16, TC17).
Security: Injection and XSS attempts for accountId are covered (TC12, TC13).
Performance / Scalability: Normal and peak load performance tests and large payload handling are included (TC09, TC10, TC11).
Response Format & Accessibility: Content-Type and valid JSON responses are asserted and accessibility/machine-readable requirement is present (TC01, TC18).
Backward compatibility & Regression: Backward compatibility and regression scenarios are included (TC14, TC15).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination behavior (limit/offset/page parameters), page links, or behavior when dataset is large but paginated. The standard guideline's pagination checks are missing.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests verify rate limiting, throttling behaviour, or expected status codes when limits are exceeded.
Caching Behavior: No tests check caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional GET (If-None-Match -> 304) or cache invalidation behavior.
Detailed Schema Validation: Tests assert "required fields" but do not validate field-level types, formats or full PlanDetail JSON schema (e.g., specific field names, types, nested objects).
Authorization granularity: Only authentication failure (401) is tested; role/permission-based authorization and 403 scenarios are not covered (if applicable).
HTTP Method Handling: No tests for method-not-allowed responses (e.g., POST/PUT/DELETE to this GET-only endpoint -> 405).
Content Negotiation & Headers: No tests for Accept header variations, malformed Accept, or response headers (e.g., Content-Length, Link for pagination).
Rate/Load edge-cases not defined: Performance tests exist but SLA thresholds and failure modes for slow responses under load are not fully specified/tested.
Negative header/body cases: Missing tests for malformed headers, very long query strings, or unusual encodings.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include limit/offset or page/size parameter combinations, verify Link headers (next/prev), behavior on page boundaries, and large-result pagination correctness.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to verify throttling, expected status codes (429), Retry-After header handling, and client behavior when limits are exceeded.
Add caching tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, conditional GET semantics (If-None-Match returning 304), and that responses include appropriate cache directives for tenants/accounts.
Improve schema validation tests: validate full PlanDetail JSON schema (field presence, types, allowed values, nested objects) and reject responses that do not conform.
Expand authorization tests: include role/permission-based access checks and 403 scenarios if the API enforces tenant or role restrictions.
Add method-not-allowed tests: ensure POST/PUT/DELETE to this endpoint return 405 with appropriate Allow header.

Add content-negotiation and header tests: test Accept header values (e.g., application/json, text/plain), malformed Accept headers, and validate other relevant response headers (Content-Length, Content-Type charset).
Clarify and codify performance SLAs: specify acceptable latency percentiles (p95/p99) and add load/spike tests that assert those SLAs and failure modes.
Add negative and edge-case tests: very long query parameter values, unusual encodings, and malformed headers to ensure robust input validation without leaking sensitive info.
